meta.title: The Battle of Stones and Rays
meta.narrative_story: A small stone decided it wanted to be a large sun. It was SMALL — insignificant, overlooked, stepped upon. It had FEW admirers and even fewer friends. When it tried to speak, its voice was NOISY — grating, irritating. The sun, by contrast, was LARGE — vast, warm, the center of everything. The stone sharpened itself to a TIP — small on top, large on bottom. Ready to pierce. Each EVENING, it watched the sun descend and dreamed of rising. There were MANY evenings like this. Years of evenings. Finally, the stone had ENOUGH. It was time. It rolled OUTSIDE the cave where it had rested for centuries. It demanded a NAME — something other than 'small stone.' Its body was THICK — layers of compressed time. It remembered: it was no mere STONE. It was ancient. It looked at the GRAVEL around it — lesser stones, shattered things — and felt pity. 'I will do something WONDERFUL,' it declared. It began TO RESEMBLE the sun — concentrating heat within itself. It tried TO PEEL away its outer layers, hoping to reveal light beneath. For one moment, it emitted a RAY — a single beam of borrowed brilliance. But it was OVERLY ambitious. One ray is not the sun. The stone learned TO ECONOMIZE — to save its light, to glow gently. It became something STRANGE — not a sun, but something the sun had never been. A stone that dreamed. A stone that almost shone.
meta.narrative_arc: An insignificant stone's ambitious quest to become a sun, learning to find its own strange brilliance

characters.narrative_position: It was SMALL — insignificant, overlooked, stepped upon
characters.etymology: Pictograph of something being divided into smaller pieces
characters.pithy_formula: So SMALL I shrink away - I GROAN 'Shyowww...' diminishing.
characters.story: I shrink down SMALL, GROANING 'Shyowww...' in low, creaky diminishment. Smaller and smaller - my zombie body compresses, my voice grows faint and low.

similar_warning.repulsion: 小 = SMALL (size); 少 adds SLASH = FEW (quantity reduced)

characters.narrative_position: It had FEW admirers and even fewer friends
characters.etymology: Small (小) + slash = few (cutting down the quantity)
characters.pithy_formula: Only a FEW remain - I GROAN 'Showww...' at the scarcity.
characters.story: Only a FEW scraps remain on my plate. I GROAN 'Showww...' in low hunger - so little left, so few morsels. The zombie starves on this pitiful portion.

similar_warning.repulsion: 少 = FEW (quantity with slash); 小 = SMALL (size without slash)

characters.narrative_position: When it tried to speak, its voice was NOISY — grating, irritating
characters.etymology: Mouth (口) + few (少) = noisy (few mouths arguing loudly)
characters.pithy_formula: The NOISY argument grates - I GROAN 'Chowww...' covering my ears.
characters.story: The NOISY argument pierces my skull. I GROAN 'Chowww...' in low agony, covering my ears. Even a few mouths make unbearable noise - creaky suffering.

characters.narrative_position: The sun was LARGE — vast, warm, the center of everything
primitives: pictograph of person with arms spread
characters.etymology: Person with arms spread wide = large (taking up maximum space)
characters.pithy_formula: I spread LARGE and COMMAND 'DAH!' - bow before my size!
characters.story: I spread my arms wide, growing LARGE, and COMMAND 'DAH!' with thundering authority. Massive, imposing - my sharp bark shakes the room. Bow before this size!

similar_warning.repulsion: 大 = LARGE (normal big); 太 adds DOT = TOO much (excessive)

characters.narrative_position: The stone sharpened itself to a TIP — small on top, large on bottom
characters.etymology: Small (小) on top of large (大) = tip (where small meets large = point)
characters.pithy_formula: The TIP pierces upward - I SING 'JYENNN!' at the sharp point!
characters.story: The TIP pierces upward where small meets large. I SING 'JYENNN!' in a sustained high note - the point so sharp, my voice rises to match its peak.

characters.narrative_position: Each EVENING, it watched the sun descend and dreamed of rising
characters.etymology: Pictograph of the crescent moon appearing = evening
characters.pithy_formula: EVENING falls and I SING 'SHEEE!' as the moon rises.
characters.story: EVENING falls across the land and I SING 'SHEEE!' in a sustained note as the crescent moon rises. The day ends, my voice holds steady in the fading light.

similar_warning.repulsion: 夕 = one EVENING (single moon); 多 = MANY (two evenings stacked)

characters.narrative_position: There were MANY evenings like this — years of evenings
characters.etymology: Two evenings (夕夕) stacked = many (many nights = many)
characters.pithy_formula: MANY evenings pile up - I SING 'DWOHHHH!' counting endless nights.
characters.story: MANY evenings pile up, night after night. I SING 'DWOHHHH!' in a sustained note, counting the endless accumulation. So MANY - the high note holds as numbers climb.

similar_warning.repulsion: 多 = MANY (two evenings stacked); 夕 = one EVENING (single)

characters.narrative_position: Finally, the stone had ENOUGH — it was time
characters.etymology: Many (多) + sentence (句) = enough (many words = enough said)
characters.pithy_formula: ENOUGH! I COMMAND 'GOH!' - no more needed!
characters.story: ENOUGH! I slam my fist and COMMAND 'GOH!' with sharp finality. No more words, no more waiting - we have ENOUGH. The discussion ends here.

characters.narrative_position: It rolled OUTSIDE the cave where it had rested for centuries
characters.etymology: Evening (夕) + divination (卜) = outside (fortune-telling done outdoors at night)
characters.pithy_formula: OUTSIDE in the dark - I COMMAND 'WHY!' banished beyond!
characters.story: I'm cast OUTSIDE into the night and COMMAND 'WHY!' with sharp rage. Banished beyond the walls, exiled to darkness - my bark echoes across empty fields.

characters.narrative_position: It demanded a NAME — something other than 'small stone'
characters.etymology: Evening (夕) + mouth (口) = name (calling out in the dark to identify)
characters.pithy_formula: Someone calls my NAME - I GASP 'MING?!' Who knows me here?!
characters.story: Someone calls my NAME in the darkness. I GASP 'MING?!' in rising shock - who knows me here?! My voice climbs as I spin to find the speaker.

characters.narrative_position: Its body was THICK — layers of compressed time
characters.etymology: Cliff (厂) + layers = thick (many layers piled up)
characters.pithy_formula: The wall is THICK - I COMMAND 'HOH!' pounding uselessly.
characters.story: The wall is impossibly THICK. I COMMAND 'HOH!' pounding against the layers with sharp frustration. So dense, so impenetrable - my fists make no dent.

characters.narrative_position: It remembered: it was no mere STONE — it was ancient
characters.etymology: Cliff (厂) + opening (口) = stone (rock broken from cliff face)
characters.pithy_formula: The STONE crashes down - I GASP 'SHIH?!' dodging death!
characters.story: The STONE crashes from the cliff above. I GASP 'SHIH?!' in rising terror, diving aside as it smashes where I stood. My voice climbs with pure survival panic.

similar_warning.repulsion: 石 = solid STONE (whole rock); 砂 adds 少 = GRAVEL (broken small)

characters.narrative_position: It looked at the GRAVEL around it — lesser stones, shattered things
characters.etymology: Stone (石) + few/small (少) = gravel/sand (small broken stones)
characters.pithy_formula: GRAVEL crunches underfoot - I SING 'SHAHHHH!' with each step.
characters.story: GRAVEL crunches under my feet and I SING 'SHAHHHH!' in a sustained whisper with each step. Sand and small stones - my voice hisses like shifting earth.

similar_warning.repulsion: 砂 = GRAVEL (stone + few = broken small); 石 = solid STONE

characters.narrative_position: 'I will do something WONDERFUL,' it declared
characters.etymology: Woman (女) + young/few (少) = wonderful (a young woman = marvelous)
characters.pithy_formula: How WONDERFUL! I COMMAND 'MYOW!' applauding the marvel!
characters.story: How absolutely WONDERFUL! I COMMAND 'MYOW!' with sharp admiration, applauding the marvelous sight. Perfect, exquisite - my decisive bark of approval rings out.

characters.narrative_position: It began TO RESEMBLE the sun — concentrating heat within itself
characters.etymology: Small (小) + flesh (月) = resemble (a small portion looks like the whole)
characters.moon_flesh_note: 月 here means FLESH, not moon
characters.pithy_formula: It RESEMBLES me! I COMMAND 'SHYOW!' pointing at my double!
characters.story: It RESEMBLES me exactly! I COMMAND 'SHYOW!' pointing at my uncanny double with sharp accusation. This flesh looks like mine - who copied my face?!

similar_warning.repulsion: 肖 = RESEMBLE (looks like); 削 adds KNIFE = PEEL (cut to shape)

characters.narrative_position: It tried TO PEEL away its outer layers, hoping to reveal light beneath
characters.etymology: Resemble (肖) + knife (刂) = to peel (cutting to make it look right)
characters.pithy_formula: I PEEL the skin away, SINGING 'SHYOWWW!' with each stroke.
characters.story: I PEEL the apple skin away in one long curl, SINGING 'SHYOWWW!' in a sustained note with each stroke of the blade. The peel spirals down endlessly.

similar_warning.repulsion: 削 = PEEL (knife cuts away); 肖 = RESEMBLE (just looks like)

characters.narrative_position: For one moment, it emitted a RAY — a single beam of borrowed brilliance
characters.etymology: Fire on legs = light/ray (fire spreading, walking through darkness)
characters.pithy_formula: LIGHT blazes forth - I SING 'GWAHHHNG!' as rays pierce the dark!
characters.story: LIGHT blazes forth on walking legs and I SING 'GWAHHHNG!' in a sustained glory. Rays pierce the darkness - my voice holds high as illumination spreads.

characters.narrative_position: But it was OVERLY ambitious — one ray is not the sun
characters.etymology: Large (大) + dot = too/overly (extra large = excessive)
characters.pithy_formula: TOO much! I COMMAND 'TIE!' - this is OVERLY excessive!
characters.story: This is TOO much! I COMMAND 'TIE!' with sharp disgust - OVERLY large, OVERLY excessive! The extra dot pushes it past the limit. Unacceptable!

similar_warning.repulsion: 太 = TOO (large + dot = excessive); 大 = LARGE (normal big)

characters.narrative_position: The stone learned TO ECONOMIZE — to save its light, to glow gently
characters.etymology: Few (少) + eye (目) = economize (keeping an eye on spending = saving)
characters.pithy_formula: Must ECONOMIZE - I GROAN 'Shungggg...' counting every penny.
characters.story: I must ECONOMIZE on everything. I GROAN 'Shungggg...' in low, creaky misery, eyes watching every penny. So few resources - the zombie budget groans.

characters.narrative_position: It became something STRANGE — not a sun, but something the sun had never been
characters.etymology: Large (大) + can (可) = strange (what CAN this large thing do? = odd)
characters.pithy_formula: How STRANGE! I GASP 'CHEE?!' at this bizarre sight!
characters.story: How utterly STRANGE! I GASP 'CHEE?!' in rising bewilderment at this bizarre impossibility. My voice climbs with each odd detail - nothing makes sense!

lesson_palace.description: A cave where a small stone dreams of becoming a sun, surrounded by gravel and pierced by rays of borrowed light

character_stations.小: Shrinking corner: body compresses smaller and smaller
character_stations.少: Empty pantry: only a few scraps remain
character_stations.吵: Argument pit: few mouths create deafening noise
character_stations.大: Giant's platform: arms spread to maximum size
character_stations.尖: Needle tower: where small meets large at the point
character_stations.夕: Sunset window: crescent moon rises in the evening
character_stations.多: Counting hall: endless nights pile up
character_stations.外: Exile grounds: banished beyond the walls
character_stations.名: Dark corridor: names called in darkness
character_stations.厚: Thick wall: impenetrable layers block the path
character_stations.石: Falling rock zone: boulders crash from cliffs
character_stations.妙: Wonder gallery: marvelous sights on display
character_stations.削: Peeling station: knives carve spiraling skin
character_stations.光: Light beacon: rays spread from walking fire
character_stations.太: Excess warning: dot marks where too much begins
character_stations.省: Budget office: eyes watch every penny
character_stations.奇: Oddity museum: strange things defy explanation

quality_summary.tone_correction: 多 is T1 (duō), not T2 as in original
